ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Mistmoor Drum Goes Poof
ygData.msgSnippet: My advice is to get in on as many naggy raids as you can.  Even if you don t get a Selo s drum one of the other bards there will.  And they ll likely give you
ygData.messageBody:
My advice is to get in on as many naggy raids as you can. Even if you don't
get a Selo's drum one of the other bards there will. And they'll likely
give you their MM Drums as a hand-me-down since they won't need them anymore
(SHH Don't tell them the Drums of the March are too fast for Song of Travel
;)

Kev
----- Original Message -----
From: <Olmoss@...>
To: <eqbards@egroups.com>
Sent: Wednesday, May 10, 2000 4:47 PM
Subject: [eqbards] Mistmoor Drum Goes Poof


> The last month has been a blast singing Chant of Flame and Fufils
> with my Mistmoor Drum... I was dropping Blues fast, mixing in a
> fear chain every so often... Then, yesterday I was switching from my
> lute, had the pointer over it and the Drum went "Poof" !!!
> I backed up and searched the ground in a panic. Nothing there !!! I
> petitioned and when the guide finally showed up her attitude
> initially was "Tough Toenails".. I finally talked her into reporting
> it to Verant as a possible Bug and if they review my log I MAY or may
> not get a replacement. Moonflower is Disconsolate.. I love that drum.
> Now the question is... at level 42, what are the chances of getting
> a Drum of Selos March as a replacement ? ..rare drop off Nagafen ?
> Any tips ?
> I appreciate any advice you guys can give me,
> Moonflower Bllue, 42 Bard
> Cazic-Thule
>
>
>
